bundle.name: snapmta

description.p: Install msmtp so email generated on this computer get transmitted to the one running postfix.

The post installation script saves the parameters entered here so msmtp works as if you installed a sendmail tool (i.e. a basic MTA) on your computer. This allows for CRON emails to be forwarded to your postfix installation.

field.name: host
field.label: Host
field.description: The domain name or the IP address of the computer running Postfix. If you have not yet installed that computer, you may want to wait before installing this MTA.

field.name: domain
field.label: Domain
field.description: The domain to use when sending emails. This is usually the name of the MTA without the "mail." part. Say your MTA has domain name "mail.example.com", then this domain name is likely "example.com".

field.name: from
field.label: From
field.description: The default email address to use with the email "From:" header. Using the wrong "From:" may prevent emails from being sent to external MTA. Note that most email servers won't accept an IP address as a destination.
